reviewText: I more or less liked half of the movies in this set and recommend it to any fan of the 50 packs. However this collection is a bit below average in comparison to the other "decade" 50 packs (my favorite is The Excellent 80's). There are many dull and boring movies here. As fans of the 50 packs know, just because a movie is sub-par does not mean it cannot be entertaining. It just can't be dull and boring.For those concerned with objectionable content, there is only a little language and nudity in this set. A couple of the movies have teaser near nudity and a bunch have violence.=====================================================================16 of the 50 movies are black & white, and a few others have very washed out color.11 of the 50 movies have a psycho/sociopath as the main character.6 of the 50 movies are about teenage sociopaths. These cookie-cutter films are B&W; teen noir melodramas with a strong 1950's flavor. In each one the main character causes harm to others and eventually comes to a bad end. HIGH SCHOOL BIG SHOT, THE WILD RIDE, THE SADIST, ANATOMY OF A PSYCHO, HIGH SCHOOL CAESAR, and THE CHOPPERS.  Teen actor Arch Hall Jr. starred in 2 of these things and a young Jack Nicholson in one.6 of the 50 movies are biopics of figures from history, legend, and the Bible. All of these films portray their subjects as 2 dimensional, somehow managing to avoid whatever it was about these people that made them unique. They are similar in style to "The Ten Commandments" with its heavy dose of invented melodrama. SWORD OF LANCELOT, CONSTANTINE & THE CROSS, ESTHER AND THE KING, ALEXANDER THE GREAT, DAVID AND GOLIATH, and HEROD THE GREAT.9 of the movies are comedies or lightly humorous. WHEN THE GIRLS TAKE OVER (hijinks on a French/Spanish island, a silly but witty treat with nice scenery unfortunately in B&W;). THE SHE BEAST (entertaining horror with a strong vein of humor throughout). THE FAT SPY (fun & witty musical comedy but probably not everyone's cup of tea). DIARY OF A TELEPHONE OPERATOR (sex-themed Italian drama/comedy -- not explicit -- about 2 beautiful women unlucky in love). WAKE ME WHEN THE WAR IS OVER (a WWll soldier is tricked by a German baroness into being her love slave). GUERRILLAS IN PINK LACE (a gambler disguised as a priest ends up on a Pacific island fighting Japanese with the help of a troupe of strippers. Some paintings of nudes are prominently displayed. Fun). SANTA CLAUS CONQUERS THE MARTIANS (kiddie sci-fi, Martians kidnap Santa and Billy & Betty to teach their own kids how to laugh and be happy. Better than some of the usual Christmas fare). THE NASTY RABBIT (tries to be moronically funny like the Zucker brothers did later, but is just moronic). CRIMINAL AFFAIR (an Italian professor studies criminals by masterminding robberies. Sort of incoherent).4 of the movies are westerns. THE JACKALS (bad guys fight over gold and girl. Vincent Price is pretty good as the old coot). THE DEADLY COMPANIONS (during an attempted robbery a gunslinger kills a woman's young son and by the time of the burial they have fallen in love -- ugh). SHOOT OUT AT BIG SAG (Preacher Hawker and his cowardly sons try to keep cattlemen out of their valley, but daughter Hannah falls for one of the "Texicans"). WHITE COMANCHE (a gunslinger helps a sheriff stop an incipient range war while also dealing with his own renegade brother. Not bad).4 of the movies are horror. BLOODY PIT OF HORROR (mostly laughable stuff but scenes of near naked women being tortured might be objectionable). THE DUNGEON OF HARROW (stranded on a leprosy island with a mad count). SOUND OF HORROR (B&W; flick has no sets and an invisible monster -- gotta be one of the cheapest Z movies ever). THE SHE BEAST (yet another reminder of why English newlyweds should not honeymoon in Transylvania! I liked this and also put it in the comedy category).5 of the movies are sci-fi or fantasies. THEY CAME FROM BEYOND SPACE (a British astronomer single-handedly resists invasion of alien body snatchers. Pretty good). THE MANSTER (sci-fi-ish horror/melodrama gives a nice look at a slice of Japanese culture. Watch for the mitosis scene near the end -- better than when Sheldon ate too much Thai food on The Big Bang). THE MAGIC SWORD (with the aid of 6 legendary heroes a young man must rescue a princess before a dragon has her over for lunch). MAGIC SERPENT (Japanese warrior wizards battle in this tale of betrayal & revenge). DEVIL'S PARTNER (man sells his soul to the devil for youth and the ability to become various animals, then kills people his doesn't like. Not sure of the genre of this one).3 of the movies are war. THE BATTLE OF EL ALAMEIN (historical battle shown from the perspective of the Italians. Bad picture, dubbed voices, and some of the tanks are just models, still it is a slightly above average war film). DESERT COMMANDO (ruthless German captain pushes his squad across the desert to kill Stalin, Truman and Churchill. They fail in various ways). THE BATTLE OF THE LAST PANZER (a mad German tank commander tries to get back to German lines. More melodrama than action. Blink-of-an-eye brief nudity).11 of the movies are action, adventure, or suspense. THE AVENGER (after the fall of Troy, Aeneas leads his band through Italy in search of a new homeland). THE CAPETOWN AFFAIR (pickpocket steals a document that gets him involved with the police and a woman). FIVE MINUTES TO LIVE (psychotic Johnny Cash tortures his kidnap victim with boring guitar music. My wife is a huge Cash fan but even she cheered at his inevitable end). DANGEROUS CHARTER (a trio of down-on-their-heels fishermen finds a fancy yacht that they haul in for salvage. The feds use the yacht to lure the guys into being unwitting bait to catch drug dealers. Good scenery & nice yacht). SANDY THE SEAL (light family adventure. Kids and their dad confront poachers who are killing the seals on Seal Island. Nice movie for the young at heart but bad picture quality). FROM HELL TO BORNEO (after a man who owns a Pacific plantation island is murdered, his smuggler brother gets into a war with the crime boss responsible and the body count mounts). THE BALLAD OF ANDY CROCKER (a bland Lee Majors vehicle about a Vietnam vet who cannot re-integrate). THE POPPY IS ALSO A FLOWER (narcotics agents on the trail of opium. The film featured a dozen great film stars but unfortunately gave the lead to stuffy tv actor E. G. Marshal). NIGHT TIDE (a sailor's girlfriend from a Greek island fears that she is of the ancient race of sirens that prey on men). LIGHTNING BOLT (sort of a C grade James Bond flick, with a high tech villain wanting to rule the world). TWISTED NERVE (an insane young man cleverly pretends to be intellectually challenged to win the trust of potential victims. Well done film of this type, however it is sure to offend people sensitive to intellectual disability issues. It opens with a disclaimer saying there is no connection between Down Syndrome and psychotic violence, then it proceeds to make a strong connection with its use of imagery during the axe scene. As the axe comes down, the movie flashes back to a blackboard depiction of a defective chromosome that a professor had linked earlier to Down Syndrome.)=======================================================================I more or less liked all of the COMEDIES except Nasty Rabbit and Criminal Affair, all the WESTERNS except Deadly Companions, all of the SCI-FI/ FANTASIES except Devil's Partner, all of the ACTION/ADVENTURE/SUSPENSE except Capetown Affair, Five Minutes to Live, Ballad of Andy Crocker, and The Poppy Is Also a Flower.========================================================================Three movies I particularly liked are:THE RELUCTANT SAINT, biopic. Through an improbable chain of events, an intellectually simple 17th century man (Maximilian Schell) becomes a friar/priest and is revealed to be the saint known now as St. Joseph of Cupertino. The beginning of the film is cliched as it concentrates on the cruel tricks played by the villagers, but once it gets past that it opens up and becomes touching and wonderfully funny. Schell's performance as the innocent big-hearted man is very good. The film is somewhat flawed but funnier than any of the comedies in this set. Of course humor is a highly subjective thing.TWO WOMEN, drama. A feisty but perhaps slightly naive woman (Sophia Loren) flees with her daughter to the Italian countryside to escape the bombing of Rome during WWll, but they run into worse trouble. Loren is both likable and beautiful here and won many accolades for her layered performance. There is a traumatic scene that becomes the central element of the film, but because it happens 2/3rds of the way through it felt a bit tacked on to me. In a different scene there is brief nudity but not gratuitous as it is used to poignantly illustrate one of the tragedies of war.THE HEAD OF THE FAMILY, drama. This Italian film examines the stresses that a couple's relationship endures when their romance results in the creation of a growing family. This is a light but not frivolous film. Every scene has a purpose and Leslie Caron's portrayal as the wife/mother is yet another incredible acting job. Having been there as a husband & father I know exactly where they were coming from with this movie.
summary: Not as Good as the Other "Decade" Sets

reviewText: I'm hooked on these 50-movie Mill Creek/Treeline dvd sets. I own 14 and plan to own many more! They are an unbeatable mix of the unexpected, the silly, the rare, and the hilarious. These are bad movies - possibly the best/worst of the bad movies - all at once, mixed up in a bucket, about 4 movies for $1.Yes, the video quality is mixed. Yes, many of these seem to be transferred from VHS sources. Yes, some movies are edited, and yes, sometimes the sound quality isn't ideal. If any of this bothers you, do not buy a 50-movie pack. You will need to pay a little more for individual dvds."Sensational Sixties" is a pretty good set, all over the map. Plenty of good, bad, laughable, and of-the-times movies here. Several made-for-tv things. Many Italian and a few Spanish films. This set leans heavily on famous actors, mostly before their fame. Ann-Margaret as a brat with black hair. William Shatner as a pair of half- Native American twins. Dennis Hopper as a young sailor in love with a mermaid. A bizarrely frantic and suicidal Elizabeth Taylor wooing Andy Warhol. Jack Nicholson as a young ruffian. Johnnny Cash as, well, a young ruffian. It's all here.The set kicks off with "Bloody Pit Of Horror", which is honestly the funniest thing ever: several Italian fashion models, looking for a castle to use as a backdrop for s&m-style; photos, find themselves imprisoned by a reclusive bodybuilder who thinks he's the Marquis De Sade. "The Nasty Rabbit" and "The Fat Spy" make an intensely weird '60s Cold War comedy double bill, and you can throw in "Wake Me When The War Is Over" for tasteless WWII comedy. A surprising number of serious action and war films here, such as the excellent "Desert Commandos". Westerns. Gladiators. Biker movies. Biblical things. "Santa Claus Conquers The Martians". "Sandy The Seal". Endless fun.Not too many truly "good" films here, though "The Reluctant Saint" and "Two Women" are both great. Most everything here is G or PG rated, safe for kids.There are several repeats here from other Mill Creek sets: "Anatomy Of A Psycho", "Bloody Pit Of Horror", "Constantine And The Cross", "Dangerous Charter", "The Fat Spy", "Manster", "The Sadist", and probably others. Look at the listing before buying.Overall, if you like weird old trash, this is a good buy. Lots of surprises, and lots of laughs. I love it!
summary: A pretty good Mill Creek set

reviewerName: Michael Noga "Jumping kings and making Haste ...
reviewText: The Sixties were an interesting time for film making. You had the beginnings a more realistic and sometimes violent cinema, but you also had plenty of light-hearted escapism. This set offers a good selection of some of the more interesting lower-echelon films of the Sixties (much lower in some cases).Twisted Nerve: This is a clever thriller that should produce a few good chills. Hywel Bennett plays a young man named Martin who falls for Haley Mills.  Through some ingenious manipulation he poses as a developmentally disabled boy (ignorantly referred to as Mongoloids when this story was filmed) so he can live in the boarding house shared by Haley Mills and her Mum. While worming his way into Haley's affections he's also sneaking out at night making some "questionable" moral choices. Good stuff.High School Big Shot: This is a trashy movie about a high school nobody who goes from zero to hero through robbery and murder. I'm sure it was meant to be a poignant teen-delinquent story but the acting and writing are so bad you can't help laughing at it. It's amusing on its own but best enjoyed in its MST3K version.Constantine and the Cross: Constantine changed the world by adopting Christianity as the religion of the Roman Empire. This movie covers that, and not all badly. The production is good and from what I remember of history it's somewhat accurate with the facts. This one was a solid win for me.When the Girls Take Over: This is a horrible film. I have no idea really what it was about but I assure you there were no "girls" "taking over" anything.Sandy the Seal: This is a warm-hearted and caring way to introduce your children to the realities of seal hunting. It's not a bad family film and the fact that it's so dated might actually raise a discussion or two among the small fry.The Deadly Companions: Peckinpah's first western is a gloomy tale of forgiveness. Brian Keith accidently kills Maureen O'Hara's son and offers to make up for it by escorting her and her son's corpse through Indian territory so she can bury him next to her husband. It's grim but still good.Wake Me When the War is Over: During the last days of WW2 American soldier Ken Berry falls out of an airplane and is nursed back to health by German baroness Eva Gabor. She doesn't tell him that the war is over for 5 years cuz she's sweet on him. When he finally leaves he thinks the war is still on and takes up fighting the Germans. To a special kind of person this movie will be a lot of fun. It co-stars Jim Backus and Werner Klemperer!The Reluctant Saint: While this movie is not very exciting or funny, it is never-the-less a well made biography of St. Joseph of Cupertino. It's one of those quiet films that kind of sneaks up on you.Diary of a Telephone Operator: This is a fairly dismal Italian sex comedy. I know the words dismal, Italian and Sex comedy don't seem like they should go together but in this case they do.Sound of Horror: Nope this one isn't about that Justin Beiber kid (hehe). It's a super low budget Spanish horror film about a group of treasure hunters who run afoul of an invisible shrieking dinosaur. It might play well with kids and nostalgia fans that enjoy the less gory horror of the olden days and some of the ways they worked around the low budget were pretty clever.
summary: This set is a veritable buffet of tasty Sixties treats! ( And a few stinkers)

reviewText: Remember the movie of the week, how about that Sunday night movie, or later in the 70's the late night movie, that last movie after the late night shows have ended. They are all here in this set and the other sets from the 70's, 40's, 80's, etc. If you really want to see them just to watch them, they are all public domain and on other Mill Creek sets, but if you want to own them in style, in a set labeled the sixties, this is the set for you. You get stars like Bill Shatner (after Star Trek), Lee Majors, James Brolin, Joan Collins, Dennis Hopper, Jack Nicholson, Sophia Loren, Vincent Price and Claudia Cardinale. OK, I cut and pasted that last part and I have no idea who Claudine Cardinale is. But, you catch my drift here. Look, are these the movies that made the movie companies Emmy's or Oscars, no way. But, they are memorable non the less. In this set you will find some great movies, some good movies, some so so movies, and some terrible movies. But, hey, it's Mill Creek, so what is the big surprise that you might find a great movie is the only surprise here. There is a reason these movies fell into public domain and it was not their mass appeal. They are however enjoyable. So, get the set, tell em' Ralph suggested it if you like.Ralph J. Fitcher
summary: Mill Creek Brings you those shlock movies of the 60's.
